intro: Sida linearifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Sida linearifolia is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It plays a role in supporting local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
